trans-unit.source: How to use scoring profiles in Azure Search
trans-unit.target: How to use scoring profiles in Azure Search

trans-unit.source: Get started with scoring profiles in Azure Search
trans-unit.target: Get started with scoring profiles in Azure Search

trans-unit.source: How to use scoring profiles in Azure Search
trans-unit.target: How to use scoring profiles in Azure Search

trans-unit.source: Scoring profiles are a feature of Microsoft Azure Search that customize the calculation of search scores, influencing how items are ranked in a search results list.
trans-unit.target: Scoring profiles are a feature of Microsoft Azure Search that customize the calculation of search scores, influencing how items are ranked in a search results list.

trans-unit.source: You can think of scoring profiles as a way to model relevance, by boosting items that meet predefined criteria.
trans-unit.target: You can think of scoring profiles as a way to model relevance, by boosting items that meet predefined criteria.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose your application is an online hotel reservation site.
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose your application is an online hotel reservation site.

trans-unit.source: By boosting the location field, searches that include a term like Seattle will result in higher scores for items that have Seattle in the location field.
trans-unit.target: By boosting the location field, searches that include a term like Seattle will result in higher scores for items that have Seattle in the location field.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can have more than one scoring profile, or none at all, if the default scoring is sufficient for your application.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can have more than one scoring profile, or none at all, if the default scoring is sufficient for your application.

trans-unit.source: To help you experiment with scoring profiles, you can download a sample application that uses scoring profiles to change the rank order of search results.
trans-unit.target: To help you experiment with scoring profiles, you can download a sample application that uses scoring profiles to change the rank order of search results.

trans-unit.source: The sample is a console application – perhaps not very realistic for real-world application development – but useful nonetheless as a learning tool.
trans-unit.target: The sample is a console application – perhaps not very realistic for real-world application development – but useful nonetheless as a learning tool.

trans-unit.source: The sample application demonstrates scoring behaviors using fictional data, called the musicstoreindex.
trans-unit.target: The sample application demonstrates scoring behaviors using fictional data, called the musicstoreindex.

trans-unit.source: The simplicity of the sample app makes it easy to modify scoring profiles and queries, and then see the immediate effects on rank order when the program is executed.
trans-unit.target: The simplicity of the sample app makes it easy to modify scoring profiles and queries, and then see the immediate effects on rank order when the program is executed.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: The sample application is written in C# using Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: The sample application is written in C# using Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: Try the free <link><linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Express edition</linkText><title></title></link> if you don't already have a copy of Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Try the free <link><linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Express edition</linkText><title></title></link> if you don't already have a copy of Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: You will need an Azure subscription and an Azure Search service to complete the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will need an Azure subscription and an Azure Search service to complete the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Create a Search service in the portal</linkText><title></title></link> for help with setting up the service.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Create a Search service in the portal</linkText><title></title></link> for help with setting up the service.

trans-unit.source: Download the sample application
trans-unit.target: Download the sample application

trans-unit.source: Go to <link><linkText>Azure Search Scoring Profiles Demo</linkText><title></title></link> on codeplex to download the sample application described in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Go to <link><linkText>Azure Search Scoring Profiles Demo</linkText><title></title></link> on codeplex to download the sample application described in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: On the Source Code tab, click Download to get a zip file of the solution.
trans-unit.target: On the Source Code tab, click Download to get a zip file of the solution.

trans-unit.source: Edit app.config
trans-unit.target: Edit app.config

trans-unit.source: After you extract the files, open the solution in Visual Studio to edit the configuration file.
trans-unit.target: After you extract the files, open the solution in Visual Studio to edit the configuration file.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, double-click app.config.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, double-click app.config.

trans-unit.source: This file specifies the service endpoint and an api-key used to authenticate the request.
trans-unit.target: This file specifies the service endpoint and an api-key used to authenticate the request.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain these values from the management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain these values from the management portal.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Go to the service dashboard for Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: Go to the service dashboard for Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: Click the Properties tile to copy the service URL
trans-unit.target: Click the Properties tile to copy the service URL

trans-unit.source: Click the Keys tile to copy the api-key.
trans-unit.target: Click the Keys tile to copy the api-key.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished adding the URL and api-key to app.config, application settings should look like this:
trans-unit.target: When you are finished adding the URL and api-key to app.config, application settings should look like this:

trans-unit.source: Explore the application
trans-unit.target: Explore the application

trans-unit.source: You're almost ready to build and run the app, but before you do, take a look at the JSON files used to create and populate the index.
trans-unit.target: You're almost ready to build and run the app, but before you do, take a look at the JSON files used to create and populate the index.

trans-unit.source: Schema.json defines the index, including the scoring profiles that are emphasized in this demo.
trans-unit.target: Schema.json defines the index, including the scoring profiles that are emphasized in this demo.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the schema defines all of the fields used in the index, including non-searchable fields, such as margin, that you can use in a scoring profile.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the schema defines all of the fields used in the index, including non-searchable fields, such as margin, that you can use in a scoring profile.

trans-unit.source: Scoring profile syntax is documented in <link><linkText>Add a scoring profile to an Azure Search index</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Scoring profile syntax is documented in <link><linkText>Add a scoring profile to an Azure Search index</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Data1-3.json provides the data, 246 albums across a handful of genres.
trans-unit.target: Data1-3.json provides the data, 246 albums across a handful of genres.

trans-unit.source: The data is a combination of actual album and artist information, with fictional fields like price and margin used to illustrate search operations.
trans-unit.target: The data is a combination of actual album and artist information, with fictional fields like price and margin used to illustrate search operations.

trans-unit.source: The data files conform to the index and are uploaded to your Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: The data files conform to the index and are uploaded to your Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: After the data is uploaded and indexed, you can issue queries against it.
trans-unit.target: After the data is uploaded and indexed, you can issue queries against it.

trans-unit.source: Program.cs performs the following operations:
trans-unit.target: Program.cs performs the following operations:

trans-unit.source: Opens a console window.
trans-unit.target: Opens a console window.

trans-unit.source: Connects to Azure Search using the service URL and api-key.
trans-unit.target: Connects to Azure Search using the service URL and api-key.

trans-unit.source: Deletes the musicstoreindex if it exists.
trans-unit.target: Deletes the musicstoreindex if it exists.

trans-unit.source: Creates a new musicstoreindex using the schema.json file.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new musicstoreindex using the schema.json file.

trans-unit.source: Populates the index using the data files.
trans-unit.target: Populates the index using the data files.

trans-unit.source: Queries the index using four queries.
trans-unit.target: Queries the index using four queries.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the scoring profiles are specified as a query parameter.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the scoring profiles are specified as a query parameter.

trans-unit.source: All of the queries search for the same term, 'best'.
trans-unit.target: All of the queries search for the same term, 'best'.

trans-unit.source: The first query demonstrates default scoring.
trans-unit.target: The first query demonstrates default scoring.

trans-unit.source: The remaining three queries use a scoring profile.
trans-unit.target: The remaining three queries use a scoring profile.

trans-unit.source: Build and run the application
trans-unit.target: Build and run the application

trans-unit.source: To rule out connectivity or assembly reference problems, build and run the application to ensure there are no issues to work out first.
trans-unit.target: To rule out connectivity or assembly reference problems, build and run the application to ensure there are no issues to work out first.

trans-unit.source: You should see a console application open in the background.
trans-unit.target: You should see a console application open in the background.

trans-unit.source: All four queries execute in sequence without pausing.
trans-unit.target: All four queries execute in sequence without pausing.

trans-unit.source: On many systems, the entire program executes in under 15 seconds.
trans-unit.target: On many systems, the entire program executes in under 15 seconds.

trans-unit.source: If the console application includes a message stating “Complete.
trans-unit.target: If the console application includes a message stating “Complete.

trans-unit.source: Press enter to continue”, the program completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: Press enter to continue”, the program completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: To compare query runs, you can mark-copy-paste the query results from the console and paste them into an Excel file.
trans-unit.target: To compare query runs, you can mark-copy-paste the query results from the console and paste them into an Excel file.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows results from the first three queries side-by-side.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration shows results from the first three queries side-by-side.

trans-unit.source: All of the queries use the same search term, 'best', which appears in numerous album titles.
trans-unit.target: All of the queries use the same search term, 'best', which appears in numerous album titles.

trans-unit.source: The first query uses default scoring.
trans-unit.target: The first query uses default scoring.

trans-unit.source: Since the search term appears only in album titles, and no other criteria is specified, items having 'best' in the album title are returned in the order in which the search service finds them.
trans-unit.target: Since the search term appears only in album titles, and no other criteria is specified, items having 'best' in the album title are returned in the order in which the search service finds them.

trans-unit.source: The second query uses a scoring profile, but notice that the profile had no effect.
trans-unit.target: The second query uses a scoring profile, but notice that the profile had no effect.

trans-unit.source: The results are identical to those of the first query.
trans-unit.target: The results are identical to those of the first query.

trans-unit.source: This is because the scoring profile boosts a field ('genre') that is not germane to the query.
trans-unit.target: This is because the scoring profile boosts a field ('genre') that is not germane to the query.

trans-unit.source: The search term 'best' does not exist in any 'genre' field of any document.
trans-unit.target: The search term 'best' does not exist in any 'genre' field of any document.

trans-unit.source: When a scoring profile has no effect, the results are the same as default scoring.
trans-unit.target: When a scoring profile has no effect, the results are the same as default scoring.

trans-unit.source: The third query is the first evidence of scoring profile impact.
trans-unit.target: The third query is the first evidence of scoring profile impact.

trans-unit.source: The search term is still 'best' so we are working with the same set of albums, but because the scoring profile provides additional criteria that boosts 'rating' and 'last-updated', some items are propelled higher in the list.
trans-unit.target: The search term is still 'best' so we are working with the same set of albums, but because the scoring profile provides additional criteria that boosts 'rating' and 'last-updated', some items are propelled higher in the list.

trans-unit.source: The next illustration shows the fourth and final query, boosted by 'margin'.
trans-unit.target: The next illustration shows the fourth and final query, boosted by 'margin'.

trans-unit.source: The 'margin' field is non-searchable and cannot be returned in search results.
trans-unit.target: The 'margin' field is non-searchable and cannot be returned in search results.

trans-unit.source: The 'margin' value was manually added to the spreadsheet to help illustrate the point that items with higher margins show up higher in the search results list.
trans-unit.target: The 'margin' value was manually added to the spreadsheet to help illustrate the point that items with higher margins show up higher in the search results list.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have experimented with scoring profiles, try changing the program to use different query syntax, scoring profiles, or richer data.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have experimented with scoring profiles, try changing the program to use different query syntax, scoring profiles, or richer data.

trans-unit.source: Links in the next section provide more information.
trans-unit.target: Links in the next section provide more information.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Learn more about scoring profiles.

trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Add a scoring profile to an Azure Search index</linkText><title></title></link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about search syntax and query parameters.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about search syntax and query parameters.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Search Documents (Azure Search REST API)</linkText><title></title></link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Search Documents (Azure Search REST API)</linkText><title></title></link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Need to step back and learn more about index creation?
trans-unit.target: Need to step back and learn more about index creation?

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Watch this video</linkText><title></title></link> to understand the basics.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Watch this video</linkText><title></title></link> to understand the basics.
